page.title: 11BRAYDON LANDLORDS,CLASS
page.content: Newcomers feel isolated because it is difficult for them to overcome the established ties. A social centre, such as a shop or hall, would help greatly in this situation. It is evident that social class restricts familiarity and certainly friendship. Even at a time of crisis some neighbours would be unaware that help was needed. One farm in Braydon is owned by a landlord who makes only rare, brief visits to the farm, leaving the running to a Manager. As some of the land is also let to tenants the local residents feel the arrangements have broken down the social structure. Certainly absentee landlords are not welcome here.
